Reviews.Title: “No frills, neat and clean, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: drlahiri
Reviews.Content: Never expected any five star luxury. The location was just great on the Gaslamp street. Walking distance from the convention center. Checking in was easy and fast. My room on the second floor was on the parking lot side. It was not a big room. A big bed filled up almost the entire room. The positioning of the washbasin inside the room just by the side of the bed was peculiar but convenient. The room may be small but very clean and well equipped with basics like fridge, flatscreen TV, Microwave and a coffee maker. Free wi-fi was a great value addition, but the connection was not always continuous or fast at least in my room. Housekeeping staffs does not follow English properly. My room remained unclean one day and the reception desk had to be informed at 3.30 pm to get it done. The front desk is nice and efficient. May nit be always smiling but efficient. The breakfast served was nothing great but ok. Be early, or you may not get any bagel at all:-)

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for bussines and tourism”
Reviews.Author: calatoru
Reviews.Content: I was there between 16 and 22 of march 2012 for a bussines meeting.It is very well situated ,downtown,near the fifth street-the street for fun and dance- and also very close to Convention center.The breakfast is included-omlette,saussages,corn flakes,coffee,tea,cheese,bread every morning.Coffee for free in the lobby.Free internet in the room and also at the bussines center.Very close from grocery,bars and everything.I,ll be back with my family.I helped a friend with a room-around 100 $ with taxes/day.

Reviews.Title: “Best value and free wifi”
Reviews.Author: natskee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in SD for 3 nights and 2 were spent here after staying in the Marriott first but we left as we felt we were being ripped off. We realised we definitely were when we found this place!This place is in the centre of the Gaslamp area and has everything you need for a brilliant stay, including really nice breakfast and free wifi. Parking was reasonable and just around the corner, 1 min away. Our room was standard in size and ameneties and perfectly clean. Really good value and perfectly located. Drive to SD Zoo took 10 mins from here. We'd go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Valentin T
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers the best service for the price you pay in the Gaslamp area. The room was clean, free internet access and an excellent continental breakfast. The staff was helpful when we asked for directions and transportation. I would certainly consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “don't be mislead”
Reviews.Author: bellek9
Reviews.Content: Some reviews make this seem like a decent place, bargain-priced, good location, basic with breakfast. Don't be mislead! The rooms are cramped, smelly, with what looks like cast-off furniture. Pillows are small square jobs, not really bed pillows. Makes you wonder about the sheets! Staff seemed nice enough but not surprised when we walked out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in nice part of town”
Reviews.Author: Nicole B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value and is within short walking distance of the gaslamp district's shops and restaurants. Although the room was fairly small and basic, it was very clean and well-appointed. This Comfort Inn also has the best continental breakfast I've had at a hotel of this type. Staff was friendly. I did not notice much streetnoise at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: J0e1
Reviews.Content: Hotel and staff were terrific. Great value. Wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one person for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Amyj1276
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an event at the Convention Center, and it was a decent location for that if you don't want to spend Hilton prices. It's only about a 15-minute walk. I feel like the building must have one time been a retirement or assisted living center because the rooms were designed in that way. The rooms are very small with only a "full" size bed, which was slightly larger than a twin. The bathroom, equally tiny, has the toilet and shower and the sink is on a counter next to the bed. I found that strange, but whatever. The room was clean, which was a huge plus. Also, the addition of a fridge and microwave in the room was a nice touch. But there were other little things that were flawed. For one, there were a few outlets int he room, but they were stretched out so that my plugs wouldn't stay in them and fell right out onto the floor. Also, the room was very stuffy and had an old-school window air conditioner. The window did open, but when closed it provided very little sound proofing from the street. In fact, I was woken up through the closed window, through the sound of the AC, and through my ear plugs by a group of raucous college-age kids around 7:30am in another room across the alley from my room. Two reasons I selected this hotel was because of the free breakfast and the free transportation to and from the airport. The breakfast was standard and decent for a hotel breakfast (assuming you're OK with food-like substances that are made to look like eggs, sausage, waffles, and high-fructose corn syrup syrup). The transportation not so much. No where on the website or in communications with the hotel did it mention that you have to take a shuttle van to the hotel. Taking the shuttle van was fine, but it was very confusing upon arriving about what I was supposed to do and where I was supposed to wait for a shuttle and which shuttle. When I asked about the shuttle back to the airport, I was told by two different people at the front desk that they no longer provide transportation back to the airport but they could call me a cab or make a reservation for a shuttle for me. I told them both that the website said otherwise, but they insisted. So I just ordered my own shuttle and it was fine. But then, as I was waiting for my shuttle to arrive, the front desk manager was telling someone else that they have a voucher for a taxi included with the hotel! I asked him about it and he said that they indeed provided transportation to the airport. When I told him he might want to retrain the front desk staff since two of them at different times told me otherwise, he acted like it was my fault! Overall, if you're only one person traveling and won't be there very long (and won't be spending a lot of time in the room), this is an OK place to stay. But be prepared to get yourself back to the airport depending on who is working the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, cheap good location. OK for fun but not for work.”
Reviews.Author: YepBeenThere
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for 1 night while visiting Camp Pendleton and needed a hotel near the airport for the outbound flight in the morning. It is 10 minutes from the airport. They do not have their own shuttle. Shuttle service is coordinated through Super Shuttle and/or taxis which are paid for by the property. This is a Choice Hotels property, so I didn’t expect much. I stayed in room 409 which is a standard King. The room is small but well kept. From an entertainment prospective, it seemed fine. Good location near many restaurants and bars. Only two short blocks to Fifth Street. The room had it’s own, window mounted A/C unit which was noisy, as was the overhead fan which hummed constantly. I shut both of them off during my stay. There was moderate street noise in the room, with an occasional police or fire truck going by. Typical large city noises. The room has a micro/fridge combo with coffee maker and small sink in the sleeping area. The bathroom is the size of a Chicklet , but was clean. It has a 32” flat screen TV. If you’re here for work, like me, this room falls short. The work desk is small and has a horrible chair. There is only ONE outlet for use with laptops, etc. The bed was good but the pillows were cheap and lumpy. The staff was cordial, but not overly friendly. Parking was $16.00 for a surface lot behind the hotel which is not monitored. Overall I would give the property a 78/100 and 90/100 for value. I would consider staying again, but would also see what else was available nearby. PROS: Price, location, good value for price bad CONS: Small rooms, horrible work area, street noise at night

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mcdoctor
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers you a great location at an affordable price. It's located steps away from all the action but you won't get the noise that comes with it. Its free breakfast is also fenomenal. Lots of patries and fresh juice, coffe and fruits and more. The staff is very helpful, attentive and try to accomodate your needs. And, to top if all off, you get a free ride from the airport! Just a great choice!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Larry J
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! Affordable! Free breakfast bar! The rooms are not enormous but satisfied the space I needed to be comfortable. If you like the San Diego night life, this place is in a great location. Everything was within walking distance. I was really surprised when they provided me a shuttle from the airport and even provided a taxi back. I would recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “My Awesome Experience at the Comfort Inn Gaslamp/Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: LovingJesus57
Reviews.Content: We decided to go on a weekend trip to San Diego and stayed at the Comfort Inn Gaslamp, It was sooooo awesome! The location was perfect! We were downtown where all the action is. Everything was in walking distance, Also, it was easy access to walk to a location where we were able to take various tours! OMG!, The staff was amazing and very helpful in recommending the various restaurants. They gave us literature which helped us decided. Cris Vasquez, you have an awesome Hotel with an awesome staff! The breakfast was sooo good! I loved the Waffles! I truly recommend everyone to come to this Hotel. It has everything you need and again, the location is perfect when visiting San Diego! Whether you are going to the Beach, or dancing, or just relaxing, this hotel is the place to be! We will be returning and coming to the Comfort Inn Gaslamp/Convention Center Hotel!! Thank you for a wonderful experience and stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Thechief21
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have picked a better hotel for the occasion. It was clean and convenient right in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel at a more than fair price. Rooms are small, but clean and functional. Very attentive and helpful staff, first-class breakfast. Would certainly stay here again. It must be good;I never write reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Good Spot”
Reviews.Author: alongidog
Reviews.Content: Look...it's a Comfort Inn, so you kind of know what you're getting. Comfortable room, pretty good breakfast--nothing fancy. The location is terrific if you're looking for the Gaslamp experience. Parking is around the corner from the hotel and will run you $16. Our room featured two (that's right, two) sinks in the sleeping quarters. Just a bit odd. Staff was friendly, but unable to accommodate our desire to get into a room a bit before the published check-in time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Laurel999
Reviews.Content: The location is the best. One block from the main strip of restaurants and bars. About 5 blocks from the convention center. Rooms are small but they are clean and maintained. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Nice breakfast included; eggs, toast, bagels, cereals, fruit, danish, coffee, juice, etc. Definitely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, friendly staff, clean rooms and good sleep”
Reviews.Author: azinca
Reviews.Content: Was worried about getting any sleep, was on 4th floor (417) view of parling lot. Slept well no problems. room is set up with 2 sinks at opposite ends in the room and is odd but was not an issue. We had 2 bikes and we had to keep them in our room, it was crowded but it was not obstructing the walkway. Older property but centrally located and easy to maneuver the streets. Parking is extra (14) and is in a open lot behind hotel. (no attendant) Breakfast is hot and cold selections. A good value.

Reviews.Title: “GET A LOT FOR YOUR BUCK”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Paul L
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent and the price quality ratio outstanding. For its category, Comfort Inn Gaslamp in San Diego gives a lot. Firendly and efficient personnel and clean rooms... The breakfast is quite a meal. I will return with pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Miserable Experience”
Reviews.Author: CBean63
Reviews.Content: My husband travels a lot. Recently, he stayed at this hotel and had a lot to say about it. Unfortunately, none of it was good. According to the hubs, he got the room on Hotels.com for $100, and he would have gotten a better sleep in his truck. There was a great deal of "city noise" from outside. The room had "old, crappy windows". The AC was a little box in the window with no real seal on the glass. "It was like there was glass there, but there really wasn't." The exhaust fan was useless. There was no sink in the bathroom; it was in the room itself, right next to the bed. "I've stayed in bigger rooms in Europe." "The last time I slept in a bed that small was when I was a kid." Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Best place near the convention center!”
Reviews.Author: TheScrape
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay here based on the other reviews on this site for a recent conventio in San Diego. Being on a budget, the huge hotels were out of my price range. To make a long story short, the Comfort Inn Gaslamp was an excellent choice. Free HOT breakfast including eggs and make-your-own waffles...plus coffee with lids to take with you saved a ton on Starbucks at the convention center. The location, while all of Gaslamp is absolutely filthy and disgusting, is pretty good. It's a quick walk to the convention center just a few short blocks away. You are one block off of 5th (the main drag), so it is fairly quiet. There are some pretty good retaurants not on 5th that are just a block down and over from here (Smashburger being one)...and they are less expensive. There is a handy CVS just a one block away, and since the rooms have refrigerators and microwaves, it is nice to be able to pick up a two liter and some grub and keep it cold in the room. Grab some bottles of water or soda to take with you to the convention center, they are $4 there. Location gets a A. Yes, the rooms are small, but not short on amenities. Other than sleeping, how much time do you really spend in the room? There is a desk if you need one, big luggage area, a chair, and the bed. A flat screen TV hangs on the wall. The sink is in the room right next to the bed, but you get used to that quickly. No biggie. Bed and pillows are very comfortable and VERY clean (no BB, I checked). Staff was freindly and helpful. The hotel also has free wifi, while slow and weak in my room, it worked enough to get e-mails done. Just don't expect to stream anything. With all the smartphones and tablets around now, I suspect the router gets hammered with bandwidth on a nightly basis, though, so I'll give them a pass on this. All in all, this is a great place to stay if you are looking for convenience and value in an overpriced convention/tourist area. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight Location”
Reviews.Author: Alfccs
Reviews.Content: Staff has been friendly and helpful. Nice for breakfast. Clean hotel, internet access and laundry service, but the sink is right beside the bed not in the bathroom. The hotel is very easy to find and located in a nice area, a lot of restaurants, clubs and shopping. Within walking distance to some attractions such as the USS Midway, to Petco Park and the Convention Center. Their parking was limited and parking lots were expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Near the Action”
Reviews.Author: Agent_Jester
Reviews.Content: We wanted a central hotel that we could call home for a few nights, secure, clean comfortable with breakfast included, but not too costly. We are well passed being impressed by the $300/ night plus hotels with 600+ rooms, marble foyers etc having been disappointed too many times before. Who spends their holiday locked in a fancu hotel room anyway - oh! newlyweds, sorry forgot. We found this the best value hotel in the Gaslamp Quarter. parking is only $16 a night and within the hotel grounds. The breakfast was more than stisfactory. Hot food eggs and sausages, muesli, muffins and fresh pastries, fruit, yoghurt and if your waist is up for it hot waffles. Coffee, including decaf. and juices Easily worth $15 each inc taxes. A 2 minute walk and you are in the middle of th restaurant and club section - ideal if you are on holiday and want to go out any night not just weekends. The staff are excellent - and there are a lot of them, not that we had any issues needing their attention. An on-site laundry which is really convenient for long-stay travellers. Definately our choice when next in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the location”
Reviews.Author: QC_in_PA
Reviews.Content: The place is nice for walking in the downtown, and nice for breakfast. But the wifi internet connection did not work for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: SailingEd
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but the location in the Gaslamp district is walking distance to restaurants, clubs and the ballpark. The staff is friendly and helpful and the breakfast is convenient. This is a great place if you've got lots to do in the area. Downside is that the room was pretty small and cramped, and music from nearby clubs can be heard over the roar of the air conditioner until the clubs close at 1:30am.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable room and staff, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: IMarge
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for a local triathlon. The reception staff were polite but far from friendly. I was shocked by the small size of the room - we could barely fit out bikes in the room. For the price I would have expected much more, and it looked much bigger in the pictures; I've had much larger rooms in Europe, where they are known for their small rooms! Otherwise the hotel room was nothing special but overall acceptable in terms of cleanliness and amenities. There was a microwave and fridge which was very convenient given the nature of our trip. Probably the best thing about the hotel was the great breakfast, with hot and cold options including waffles, eggs, sausages, cereals, fruit, yogurt, juice and coffee. The location was also convenient, being within walking distance to the gaslamp district and the shoreline. I probably wouldn't stay here again, since I think that I could get a better rate for what this hotel had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and afforadable in the heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: SW-travelers
Reviews.Content: The location of this place is extremely convenient. Just a short drive from the airport and within walking distance to the waterfront attractions such as the USS Midway, to Petco Park and the Convention Center. The Gaslamp area is chock-full of bars and every night we were there, the streets were teeming with nightlife. Unfortunately, those bar-goers are not quiet and the outside noise really carried into our room. Running the air conditioner drowned out the outside noise but it was just as loud and annoying. If you are sensitive to noise, bring some earplugs if you want to sleep. This isn't the most up-to-date place nor do they have the biggest rooms, but they do pack a lot of features (microwave, mini-fridge and flat screen TV) into the smaller space and the rooms are very clean. Parking is was not the most convenient process. Their usual lot was full, so we were directed to a public pay lot across the street. The hotel provided a ticket that ensured we would pay only the normal hotel rate opposed to the posted public lot rate. The drawback was that you had to get a fresh ticket everyday from the front desk, since they were only good until Noon the following day. The free breakfast every morning wasn't too shabby. We were both happy with the selection and the quality of the food. The free internet was fast and mostly stable. They business center had a printer (!!) we could use to print our boarding passes. I am happier about that than is normal, I think :) Our interactions with the staff were positive as a whole. The Friday night we checked in, there was only one staff member there to assist and he had to juggle the phones, walk-in guests and guests with reservations. He kept a positive attitude without and ensured that those of us with reservations were cared for first. I did appreciate that very much. We would stay at this hotel again when visiting San Diego and looking for a convenient location. We just might not rent a car and save ourselves the parking fees. :)

Reviews.Title: “A Generic Hotel - No Problems”
Reviews.Author: execubob
Reviews.Content: Plain and simple. Clean and functional. No suprises, no excitement. Just fine for a 2 day business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location, & customer service at Comfort Inn Gas Lamp!!!”
Reviews.Author: AEmamali
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Comfort Inn Gas Lamp! It is an extremely convenient location for easy highway access to attractions & beaches as well as walking distance to local bars, restaurants, shopping, etc. The staff was consistantly prompt & friendly with us for the duration of our stay (5 nights). Parking is an additional fee, but with the affordable room rates it's still a great value. Rooms are not huge, but offer a fridge, microwave, free wi-fi, a nice size flat screen tv, & free hot breakfast daily. Overall we had an awesome time & would happily stay again in the future! We are very happy to have found such a great spot for first trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “High price for low standard”
Reviews.Author: herbert_eins
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was pretty expensive for what it had to offer. It was extremely noisy (you heard every door!), the staff was partly unfriendly (especially the check-in lady) and the room was old and not really in a very good shape. The only plus was the location in Gaslamp, everything was really close and easy to reach by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: fespo7888
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with 17 yr old while visiting San Diego for baseball game at Petco Park. Upon check-in they had some sort of problem with my reservation that I made through the Choice Hotels site. It took about 20 mins to figure out the problem. The manager eventually got it and I was checked in. This was slightly frustrating since we were running a little late in getting into San Diego due to lots of traffic. Anyway, the room was fine. The layout is a bit weird with the sink right next to one of the beds (not in the same space as shower) but workable. Room was clean. Beds in all the Comfort Inns are very hard. Nice flat screen tv in the room. Parking right around back. Breakfast is decent and room is spacious where you eat it. The only problem was our room was facing the street and we heard alot of traffic noise and people walking the streets. We had the A/C on which muffled some of the sound, but request room NOT facing the street for more quiet. The location is perfect for going to the Gas Lamp quarter which is loaded with great restaurants and bars. We where there on a Saturday night which was extremely busy night. We were not allowed in some of the restaurants because my son was not over 21. I think this place is great but maybe not with young kids especially at night. Lots of young college people here who are definitely out to party. Petco park is beautiful place to see a ballgame and the beaches, Silver Strand especially are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, tiny ,tiny”
Reviews.Author: hey_you69
Reviews.Content: Comfort Inn is small 4 floors no pool or fitness center no luxeries and our room was tiny, a closet. They did try to fit a lot into the room, refrig and a microwave but still not much room to move around. The rate went up during the convention too. Staff was friendly but not helpful.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place to Stay In San Diego!!”
Reviews.Author: pinkcaddygirl
Reviews.Content: Is this a luxury hotel.....no. But, I give it an excellent rating because it is excellent for what I want when I stay in San Diego! I first stumbled upon this place about a year and a half ago when I was traveling to San Diego for a convention. I wanted some place affordable, but nice and within walking distance to the Convention Center. I am so glad I found the Comfort Inn Gaslamp! I liked it so much that I just recently returned from my third stay at this hotel! Here is What I Like: 1. It's affordable 2. It includes breakfast which helps save money! 3. It's within walking distance to all the fun bars and restaurants. 4. The front desk staff! They are welcoming, helpful and can give you lots of info about the area. 5. The "vibe" of the place. You almost feel as if you have stepped back in time. The rooms are very small so you need to know that in advance. However, the beds are comfortable. The rooms are very clean and it's nice to have a refrigerator. I enjoy it so much that I'm already planning a trip back to this hotel for September!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: boots094
Reviews.Content: We loved our experienced at the comfort inn on G street as we always do. The hotel is right in the heart of San Diego, where all the happening are going on. close to all the places of intrest. The rooms are very clean, I like the fact we have a fridge in the room, & a mircovave. The hotel staff are great always willing to help you in your needs.Waking up in the morning and having a good breakfast to start your day of right.!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: aneilm
Reviews.Content: Comfort Inn Gaslamp is as their slogon says "Best Location In Downtown" My wife and I visited here in July 2011 and to be honest our expectations were not high having chosen here only on the location factor (in the gaslamp district). We were more than pleasantly surprised by the Comfort Inn Gaslamp mainly for the following: 1) The rooms were small but extremely comfortable and very very clean; 2) The bed was a double so not very spacious but very condusive to sleep, it was in the medium to firm range, just perfect after a day of exploring the city. There were nice pillows and again the key factor was clean; 3) The hotel staff were very service oriented and past reviews seemed flawed in this area. The front desk staff were courteous, the room staff were efficient and you get more in service than what you pay for at this hotel, another plus; 4) The location is ideal, you are a few short steps away from the Horton Plaza (best shopping in the area), you are about three blocks from party and eating central (5th avenue) and you are out of the way enough to get a good quiet night's rest. 5) The breakfast - This was the only factor that did not have this hotel earning the best review. The breakfast was one of the poorest we have ever experienced (we are avid world travellers). It was too processed, too cheaply prepared and even a budget hotel can do better than what was presented here. the seating was as inadequate as the food and we feel that this is where Comfort Inn can improve on the most. Out of ten, we rate this breakfast at best a one! Thankfully, this food experience was not a reflection of San Diego's cuisine and guests will find great foods everwhere else. Apart from the breakfast experience, in all, to everyone who wants to enjoy san diego downtown on a budget and great accomodation, we strongly recommend Comfort Inn Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “Great location all of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kenandjoy
Reviews.Content: Just a short walk to the Conference Center, all of Gaslamp District just out the door, and close to public transportation to travel to Balboa Park and Old Town. Convenient location yet relaxed atmosphere from being just one block away. I found the clerks ever to helpful and knowledgeable about transportation and all of San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience!”
Reviews.Author: nmspencer
Reviews.Content: This property was an absolute "sleeper" for my wife and I, as we were like two ships passing in the night! I had been traveling for some time, and we were to be in San Diego for one night together. Having lived in the Gaslamp a while ago, we wanted to stay downtown, but were concerned about cost, amenities, etc. The Comfort Inn Gaslamp met every one of our expectations, was very well situated and we enjoyed the breakfast the following morning. It was just a great place to get reacquainted, in a nice room, and a very attractive facility. We will definately be back and will stay here at every opportunity. Oh, yeah, the staff is really friendly and competent too!

Reviews.Title: “Spend time in the area NOT the room”
Reviews.Author: TeamSS
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this hotel, upon arrival we were not greeted instead given a look of disapproval. Following check in we were told the paid parking was in the public carpark across the road without surveillance even though there were still spots available all night in the hotel carpark. Room is clean but very small basically there is only a foot around the bed available for moving around. Breakfast was included but we missed it as we were not informed it finished at 9.30am not the usual 10am industry standard. Checkout service was non existent, she was on the phone the whole time. Location is an A+++, shame about the service!!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: lefty21
Reviews.Content: I frequently come to San Diego on Business and always stay at the Comfort Inn Gaslamp. The service is great, rooms are clean, price is right and I'm never disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Downtown SD”
Reviews.Author: jwalsh33
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, right in centre of Downtown. Rooms were very clean and functional, but they were small, standard double small, so upgraded to Room with bigger bed Staff were very friendly, recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: 2bikers
Reviews.Content: good central location but also very noisy at night

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, cheerful, compact – great location.”
Reviews.Author: L0ve2Fish
Reviews.Content: TRANSIT – free shuttle FROM airport. We had dropped a FOX car rental off and walked down the Promenade. LOCATION - Gaslamp area is where action is. Easy walk to trolley lines, restaurants, waterfront. Parking fees apply. Lot of weirdos wandering around talking to themselves. CHECKIN – efficient but impersonal. ROOMS – stayed in Rm 414 initially. Shewn kind enough to offer us another room as some alarm going off all night external to the Hotel. Mattresses in each room were squeaky (old) – ok if you don’t move in your sleep. Cheap & cheerful. This is central city so be prepared for road noise – did not interrupt our sleep though. BREAKFAST – good selection but no toast.

Reviews.Title: “Soo Good!”
Reviews.Author: Fidelis_11
Reviews.Content: Had to attend the Convention of the American Association of Clinical Endocrinologists at the Convention Centre. The Hotel is suitably placed. Very good Breakfast. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel was perfect for me. Everything is central and right outside the front door.”
Reviews.Author: kingsville21
Reviews.Content: Enjoy the fantastic breakfast! The Gaslamp night life is a wonderfu experiance for all ages!

Reviews.Title: “has all what you need but no lusury”
Reviews.Author: eyecairo
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable hotel with almost all necessities and semi-necessities of travelers, but on no lusuorius basis. Booking through Expedia, very smooth check-in, pull my suitcase myself to the elevator few steps away, and walk my luggage wheels in the corridor to my room (no bell boy! Immagine?!) Smallish room, not on the street, but on an open inner courtyard, has a sink in the room, BUT, wonderfully enough: clean, comfortable furniture, and has almost everything you might need, LCD TV, coffee maker with ready coffee and tea bags various kinds, working desk, microwave, place to put utensils if you would like to, decent bathroom and bathtub with shower, missing the sink which is in the room, free wireless internet, which you have to renew every 4 hours, decent breakfast in the morning. If you just finish the coffee in your room, there is a 24 hours coffee in the reception area for you, and a basket of fresh apples for you to pick one on your way to your room if you need. Feeling of safety was not scratched neither in or around the hotel. I got used very quickly to the sink in the room, and was not much innterested to get a street view from my window. I stayed there for 8 nights, and found it to be one of the best values. My complaints if any are minimal like the house keeping missing to replace the used coffee packs once or twice, but I had the coffee in the reception. The reception staff were always there to help you if needed I have to congratulate the management on their abiliity to achieve this difficult equation of fecundability and not missing a necessity for comfort.

Reviews.Title: “A RUDE hotel in a GREAT location.”
Reviews.Author: ryx2469
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that this hotel is in a GREAT location and we would probably stay there again. Now, lets be honest here so you can decide for yourself. Pros: Great location (walking distance to everything!) and truly SMOKE FREE. Oh, and very good free breakfast before 9:30. Cons: 1) The rudest personel I have ever seen. From the front desk to the maids to the little ladies making breakfast. 2) On our last day we found a "critter" (the brown kind) in the bathroom. I killed it and left it for the maid to clean. 3) Bathrooms- water pressure and temperature fluctuate every few seconds. TP was the cheapest I've ever seen. 3) Nobody told us that frige is NOT on so we lost some things that went bad overnight. After we turned it on, it was very cold. 4) Their paking lot is very small so we had to park across the street at a discounted rate of $16 per day. RECAP: The rooms are overpriced for their size. The bathroom is only toilet and shower. Sink and vanity are in the sleeping area. If you can disregard the rude/unhospitable personnell, this New York City Style (crank windows) hotel is in a GREAT LOCATION. If they would just fumigate...

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: TTJD
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for the National AAHPERD Conference last week and had the pleasure of staying at this hotel. While my room was very small, the room was exceptionally clean and the continental breakfast was better than I could have imagined. Granola cereal, fresh bagels, and "make your own waffles"....who could ask for more? At the end of my stay there, my worst nightmare happened, I went to check my bag at the airport and realized I had forgot my laptop in my hotel room. I paniced obviously! So, I called the hotel and asked them to grab it out of the room and order it a taxi, I would then meet the taxi cab driver curbside and pay the laptop's fare. The gal at the front desk asked me to hold on while she checked with her GM. She came back and said, "Our general manager is going to drive it out to you curbside.....what airline are you on?" WOW! They saved the day and wouldn't even take my money in return for their services. I cannot say enough good things about my stay at this hotel. Customer service is #1 in their book and was much appreciated by me!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price or location”
Reviews.Author: yellerdog1
Reviews.Content: Best price in the area and the convenience to walk out the door and be surrounded by shops and an outdoor cafes/restraunts trumped the inconvenience of a small room and it was small and dated, Happy with the breakfast and the friendliness of the staff. 15 minute walk to the convention center or a $5 cab ride. Traveling by myself so just wanted a place to sleep, so no complaints from me.

Reviews.Title: “I live in San Diego and ALWAYS stay at Comfort Inn for these reasons”
Reviews.Author: joenews77
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn Gaslamp Hotel is affordable, comfortable, clean and in a great location. Sometimes if I have a date or want to mingle downtown I find that getting a hotel is the best bet. I've traveled all over the world and stayed at everything from a beat down 1 star to the Ritz, but I like being in the middle, not splurging on my accommodations since I don't spend much time at the hotel anyways. I am a repeat visitor to the Comfort Inn for the following reasons: * The location can't be beat. You're right on 6th and G, in the middle of all the "hot" clubs, dining and close to shopping. At the same time you can feel that ocean breeze and see the waves if you look down the right street. * Breakfast is delicious. I like saving money on breakfast and eating at the hotel. Their breakfast has fruit, eggs, potatoes and an assortment of cereals. It is a great way to enjoy a big meal and a light lunch, then have a KILLER dinner! * Rooms. You are downtown and your nightly rate is affordable and so the rooms size will coincide, they're not huge. This is not a party hotel, it is perfect for two friends, a couple or a solo person. If you have more than one with you try to get a corner room- they have the best views anyways. Either way, ALL rooms have awesome amenities, cold A/C if you need it, cable T/V, alarm clock, etc. * Staff. They have someone at the front desk all night and that makes me feel good. The front desk will tell you where the ice machine or snack machine is, and they'll answer your questions. All in all when I go downtown I stay at the Comfort Inn. It is a great place with afford-ability, comfort and FUN in mind!

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller888
Reviews.Content: This was our first time stayed in this hotel. It was in the perfect location near Gaslamp district and price is right. We also loved the breakfast and my personal favorite was the waffle maker. We just came back from another Best Western Hotel today and we really enjoyed the waffle breakfast. The overall services and the room were all good, they thought about everything for the guests need. We totally love this hotel and we definitely will stay there again when we go down to San Diego again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “So clean.”
Reviews.Author: SmithvilleAnchorman
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this hotel. It was a very very very small room compared to what I normally have but it was so clean, comfortable beds, friendly people and a very nice included breakfast. I was very happy with my stay here. I think this staff is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: ivangarcia120
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Gaslamp Quarter for Valentines Day weekend and it was very inexpensive trip considering location, friendliness of staff and the free continental breakfast. Everything is within walking distance of the hotel (restaurants, the bay, etc.)The rooms are a bit small, but overall it was a great experience. We went Kayaking, ate brazilian, went down to the bay at market street and watched the air show! Overall great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great value”
Reviews.Author: Lisa60653
Reviews.Content: The front desk people were very friendly and helpful. The location was just a few blocks from the convention center and within walking distance of a shopping mall and restaurants. the rooms were clean and checking in and out was a breeze. I was most impressed with the front desk people and the ladies who were in charge of the breakfast area. The were constantly walking around and making sure everyone had what they wanted and kept the place very clean. I would stay here again and would recommend the Comfort Inn to others.

Reviews.Title: “the location and price can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: ExPatinNica
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a conference at the convention center. The hotel is a short walk (less than 10 minutes) from the convention center and convenient to lots of restaurants. It is also within a longer walk (about 2 miles) to the famous San Diego zoo and surrounding park, but in case you don't want to walk that far there is public transportation available and taxis were fairly reasonable. The (free) WiFi worked almost flawlessly. The hotel is old and is clearly in need of an update, but it was clean and the staff were uniformly pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was adequate but nothing special. I had no trouble sleeping but there was occasional noise from outside audible. There is no pool or exercise facility but apparently you can use (free) a nearby gym. I did not have time to try it so I can't comment on it. The room was small and not stylish but included what I want: in room coffee and WiFi, plus a microwave and a refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “The Gaslamp Comfort Inn is the place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: toddseiler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several visits, and each has been a pleasant stay. The hotel is centrally located, but what is outstanding is the staff. There is no one who cannot help you with information, points of interest, places to eat, and highlights of San Diego. If you do not have transportation, a taxi is minutes away. Parking is available on site and there is easy access to the local highways. The Comfort Inn at the Gaslamp area of San Diego is my first choice when I am in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “You stay at the Ritz, I'll be at the Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: Sacratomato
Reviews.Content: After coming off a cruise ship, my wife did NOT like the Comfort Inn Gaslamp at first. The hotel's rooms felt dated and frumpy. The bathroom design, with the sink in the sleeping area, not in the bathroom, seemed very odd. But....the location is beyond excellent and the rooms are clean. There is a refrigerator, microwave and iron with ironing board in the room. There is free WiFi and two free computers with printers in the lobby. There is a washer and dryer for guests. It seems someone actually sat down and thought about all the amenities a traveler really needs. Not a four story lobby, but a handy washing machine? That's thoughtful! The free full breakfast is not haute cuisine, but the word "full" is not false advertising. However, if noise bothers you, definitely ask for a room that doesn't face the street. The windows are not double paned. The hotel itself is quiet, but downtown San Diego is not. The longer we stayed at the Comfort Inn, the more we appreciated all the extra amenities it had for guests. We plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, simple but clean, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: katushka65
Reviews.Content: We had a really good visit at this centrally-located, clean, simple and pleasant hotel. The front desk staff was really nice, particularly the manager (I think her name was Cris Vasquez), with a delightful personality and good local recommendations for places to eat and visit. The breakfast buffet was better than average, with fresh fruit and yogurt as well as cereals, pastries and the usual eggs/sausage/waffle dealie. We got a good rate on line and were just very happy overall. My favorite thing was that the room felt CLEAN, even though it was very small, and the bed was firm. My partner loved that the underneath sheet didn't come undone in the night (maybe they even used *real* fitted sheets? I can't remember now...). All around, we were very happy with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Super value, clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: Rialb
Reviews.Content: Great location. Closeto many, many restaurants. Doreen, front desk, extremely helpful and friendly. Manager Chris Vasquez takes great pride in this property. Superb value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service & services, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Gina_Romano1
Reviews.Content: Exceeded my expectations! The location was an easy walk to the convention center and was in the center of the Gaslamp District's many restaurants and shops. The free airport shuttle, wireless Internet, complimentary business center, impressive full breakfast with choices including yogurt, eggs, sausage, waffles,and the helpful attitude of the staff smoothed my trip immensely. So many of those things one has to do for travel were much easier and included in the hotel price! The accommodations are not luxurious but the bed and shower were terrific, the desk and lighting were great--all conducive to a good stay for business. A little street noise from my 2nd floor streetside room might have been reduced or eliminated by a room higher up and facing a different direction. I look forward to staying at this great place any time I'm in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Just enough for one”
Reviews.Author: libb0y
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the San Diego Convention Center. For little more than $100 a night I got a hotel room that was within walking distance of the Convention Center, various association meetings, and vendor receptions at other Gaslamp hotels and restaurants. Plus my room had free in-room wifi, a refrigerator, microwave, cable TV viewed on a wall-mounted flat screen tv, AND the hotel had a hot breakfast every day! Thank goodness I was alone because two of us would not have fit. I had heard that rooms were small but was surprised to see just how small this room was. Don't get me wrong -- there was enough room for ME alone. To give you an example of how small it was my bed was a standard full size bed; I doubt if a queen size bed would fit in the room. I could sit on the edge of the bed and use the sink (only a shower/tub and toilet in the bathroom), microwave, and refrigerator. The bed was just the right firmness and I fell asleep quickly and had a restful night's sleep. The hotel and neighborhood around it was quiet; no loud noises even though it was on a busy street. The view out my window was of a wall a few feet away. There were bars, restaurants, stores, and San Diego bay attractions within easy walking distance. The room was exactly what I needed for four days at a business meeting/conference. I was hardly in my room except for sleeping. The room is just right and priced right for a business meeting attendee who is there by himself and won't be doing any entertaining in the room. If that describes you then this room and hotel is just what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, cozy and clean”
Reviews.Author: belledog
Reviews.Content: As a single woman traveling to an unfamiliar city, i was concerned about hotel safety and security. There was someone on the front desk 24/7 and they actually looked you in the eye when you came in or left so i felt like they were really paying attention to the comings and goings of people walking into the hotel. This was reassuring. The room was small, but clean and comfortable. I had a small fridge, a microwave, coffee maker as well as free high speed wifi and tv. The hotel was decorated so festive for the Christmas holidays. It seemed management and staff really cared. And about the staff- the front desk people were so friendly and helpful- while not a formal concierge they acted in the same capacity and made useful suggestions as well as callng cabs and answering other questions about the city. The Gaslamp location is a hotspot of activity. Alot of clubs, restaurants, shopping ops, in addition to being right on the waterfront. I felt quite safe going out by myself in the early evening. Seemed there were always plenty of people out and about and the streets are well lit.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, extremely friendly staff, clean, comfortable, good sized rooms.”
Reviews.Author: AWATravel
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Comfort Inn Gaslamp. We have stayed at numerous Choice Hotels in the San Diego area in the past two years, as I have a relative in assisted living whom we visit. I am so glad that I found this hotel! It is clean, comfortable, friendly, and great for walking around downtown. The free breakfast is well maintained with good choices. Horton Plaza is only a few blocks away, as well as Ralph's grocery store, and the Gaslamp District, with it's trendy restaurants and watering-holes, is even closer. And, it's very convenient to San Diego International airport. We have stayed in two different rooms. Both have in-window air conditioning units that are really good. They are not loud, like many hotel rooms with a/c heating units can be, not at all. And, since it's such a nice climate. one has the option of opening a window for fresh air! Both rooms had a small fridge and microwave, and excellent cable for TV. The room is a decent size, clean, but the sink not in the bathroom itself. This works, as the mirror is not all steamy from the shower! Both of our rooms had ceiling fans. I do not know if all rooms have ceiling fans, but this was a nice feature. We will be staying at the Comfort Inn Gaslamp again, as it will be my number one hotel at which to stay in the San Diego area from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate-Good Place”
Reviews.Author: Jan B
Reviews.Content: For business travelers this is a good choice for the Gas Light District. The room was a bit small but for the price it didn't matter. I was in on business for 1 night, working on a strict travel budget. Mattress comfort was adequate. The room was clean as well as the facility. Within walking distance to stores. Free airport shuttle and WiFi in room. Staff was friendly and helpful. I'll be staying there again. Be careful of what you select to eat from the grocery store Albertsons. I Immediately got sick after eating their chicken winds and chicken cesar salad.

Reviews.Title: “Mr. Price Is A Gem”
Reviews.Author: Continental American
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a time when every hotel in San Diego was expensive, and I got a good deal at the Comfort Inn Gaslamp, I wasn't expecting anything extraordinary, and I ended up very pleased. A gentleman at the front desk named Mr. Price greeted me like a long lost friend and also paid for my Super Shuttle from the airport with a voucher that the hotel supplies. What a really nice extra. They really don't have to do that. Mr. Price was unfailingly friendly and helpful throughout my stay - always smiling with something nice to say. The room was quite nice and pleasant - almost like a little apartment with a microwave, good FREE internet etc. Everything was clean and in decent shape. Good if unfancy bathroom with strong water pressure. Lots of things that others charge for are free here. There is a substantial full breakfast each morning that you can eat as much of as you want. The freshly made waffles are really nice. Newspapers available too. The location in the Gaslamp district was convenient and close to many restaurants and public transportation. It was my first visit to San Diego, and I got around fine car-free. While this hotel may not be for the overly fussy and demanding, I think most people will be happy here, and I left feeling that I got very good value. I hope Mr. Price is still there next time I stay. He's certainly qualified to work at the finest most upscale hotel in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: MaxonianPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but were made to feel very welcome; the hotel appeared to be quite busy yet they found time to answer questions; the parking though not free, was an asset.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: snowbaby101
Reviews.Content: Best price for easy walk to convention center, Petco stadium and Gaslamp district. small room, but very clean with microwave, refrigerator and coffee pot in room. Great selection for included breakfast, Eggs, sausage, waffles, oatmeal and wide selection of cold cereal, muffins and pastries. The staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: vldmran
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in gaselamp historic district in hurt of downtown. You can easy walk to shops and restaraunts, also you can see beautiful sunset on the bay area. San Diego Zoo and Balboa park is located ten minut by car. Frendly staff invites you clean, but small room. Parking charge is 18$ per day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend”
Reviews.Author: mikeyOtayMesa
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here over memorial day weekend and we had a blast. This is where you want to be. From restaurants to bars, and we even went to a baseball game across the street at Petco Park. Rooms were basic but nice, service was excellent, and breakfast was better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Horror In The Gaslamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: justahavenfun
Reviews.Content: The weekend of May 23rd 2010 was not a good one and missing my plane flight was only the tip of the iceberg; the Comfort Inn in Gaslamp was the rest of it. I booked a last minute room at the Comfort Inn in Gaslamp expecting the same quality of other Comfort Inns I've stayed at, truth be told, I was sadly mistaken. When I made the reservations, they had mentioned that airport transportation was free, do not believe them, it is free from the airport not to the airport. I was forced to take a taxi that took $15.00 to get to the airport in the morning. Aside from that flagrant lie, it is not the only thing that went wrong. Upon entering the hotel, the lobby looked okay, there was a fish tank with a huge puffer fish in it which was kind of neat, little did I know upon checking out that I would feel horrible for the fish that have to inhabit that hotel. After checking in I proceeded to my room located on the 4th floor by taking the elevator which you swear was going to break down at any given time it was so slow. Upon arriving at my floor and walking down the hallway to my room, I had a lingering suspicion that I was walking straight into a dump. I got to my room and the first thing I noticed after opening the door was an unbearable odor of what seemed to be fecal matter. I could not locate the source of the stench but it seemed to emanate from the carpet. Wherever it came from, it was strong enough to keep me up all night feeling ill. The second thing I noticed was the window that had a air conditioner sticking out of it and upon further inspection, a large gap in between the wall and the window which the gap was large enough to let bugs in. The room was extremely small, very dissapointing as I've stayed at a nicer, larger hotel room for the same price in the past. The bed was tiny, taking up most of the room, the little room you had left to walk was cut short by the sink situated 1 foot or so from the bed, very strange as I've never seen a sink in the bed area, you'd think it would be located in the bathroom? As for the sleeping situation, I slept with my jeans, shirt and socks... Usually I sleep more casual in a hotel but I feared the worst and during the little sleep I did get, I was violently awoken by a horrible itching sensation, I have had fears that I had contact with bedbugs in this room yet nothing has been confirmed. If I could rate this night as a 0, I would as there is no redeeming qualities other than the puffer fish. Avoid this place like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: surfindog
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem. Great value and location. Staff was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced hotel in good area.”
Reviews.Author: jimok78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a trip around California for one night. The rate was good, and although the rooms were small they were clean and had all things you would require. This is no luxury hotel, but thats reflected in the very good room rate. Its in a good area (gaslamp district). I would stay there again if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous weekend”
Reviews.Author: RCT_10
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon the Comfort Inn a short two block walk from the "gaslamp district" Very clean hotel with friendly staff...cheapest parking in the area...and breakfast in the morning. If you are wanting to party near the gaslamp and not want to drive this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and not a bad price!”
Reviews.Author: mjclough81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September 2009 for 3 nights with my girlfriend. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean, modern and comfortable. The best bit for us was the location - right in the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter, but also really close (5-10 mins taxi to the Zoo and beach). Having only just signed up to TripAdvisor, this trip was a few months back, but neither of us can remember a single thing to complain about. The price, too, was very good. May well be back this September as i have another trip to CA planned!

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful Design, Terrific Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: mike110742
Reviews.Content: [This note to Priceline & other third-party guests precedes most of my reviews of hotels I purchased through a 3rd party vendor] 3rd-party customers read reviews and arrive with expectations; high attentiveness to guest needs distinguishes one 2-3-4 star from others. Third-party prices fill rooms, and provide the business with opportunities to sell services and win future customers. My advice post-purchase: pay attention to reviews, articulate needs clearly (both in advance and on arrival) and speak directly and immediately to management if your expectations are not met. If basic room needs are unmet, ask management for adjustment; if unresponsive, tell the 3rd-party vendor in writing; use snail mail to the company’s street address and direct to Customer Service VP. I’ve found both Hotwire and Priceline highly responsive. Talk to management directly and pleasantly: they value meaningful guest feedback and often can use information you provide to correct persistent problems. Whatever rate you paid, be courteous and civil to a fault: it never helps to be confrontational. Commend with care what is commendable.] Hotels can be tough and expensive in San Diego, even on Priceline; I paid $70. This is a compact, centrally-located hotel with 103 rooms in the Gaslamp District of downtown San Diego. It’s locally owned, and Comfort-Choice branded. It’s a modest walk to bus routes and the trolley, not far from the stadium or Civic Center performance venues. It’s a quick cab ride from Amtrak’s Union Station, and not far from the water. PLUS FEATURES: Airport shuttle (I did not use; hotel is specific about airport-only, though amtrak is on the way); terrific bedding; free wireless that works well; friendly desk and housekeeping staff; free complete breakfast and business center; coin laundry machines near the front desk. Rooms have a tiny footprint, not unlike a New York hotel room; but are beautifully designed with obvious careful attention to guest comfort. Every room has a refrigerator and microwave and coffee maker. The vanity and kitchen counter are next to the bed; tub and toilet separate with a sliding door closure to the bathroom. Working window AC, baseboard heating unit. Hot and cold water spigots were reversed and unmarked, an odd but small problem that was cheerfully fixed within minutes of my reporting it. ONE THING I’D FIX: Heat is supplied by a baseboard until, and the controls are awkward to find and locate; it’s slow to respond. Small signage atop the unit would take care of this. AND: Ask to be placed away from large groups of young people. I wasn’t bothered but saw potential for hallway noise based on the youth and exuberance of other guests. One day, noise from an adjacent room’s shower was deafening, but this can be fixed simply by sliding the bathroom door closed.

Reviews.Title: “small, but clean and comfortable rooms- a good value & great location”
Reviews.Author: Lu1822
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn because I was traveling with a friend who had already made a reservation at the hotel. After reading some of the other reviews, I was somewhat apprehensive about staying at the Comfort Inn. After a late flight from Atlanta to San Diego, we arrived at the check-in desk at 1 AM. The clerk on duty was accommodating and checked us in efficiently. When I arrived at the room I was somewhat surprised at how small the room was, and the sink area was next to the bed and not in the bath area. I had to remind myself that I was paying about $110 a night as opposed to the $260-300 a night at one of the hotels next to the convention center. The room was very clean and comfortable. The TV was relatively new and worked; wireless Internet was free and the only hitch was the entire hotel lost the signal for about 12 hours. The room rate included a breakfast buffet, which consisted of the usual assortment of cereals and pastries but also included scrambled eggs and sausage. Without exception, every interaction I had with staff was positive. They were always interested in how they could help. The property was very clean and did not have that worn appearance that often plagues low-cost hotels. Overall, I thought the stay was a good value. The room was small, but substantially less costly than the bigger name brand hotels adjacent to the convention center. The location was great, only about two blocks from the main drag of the Gas Lamp area and the restaurants. The convention center is about a 5 block walk. If you're looking for a relatively low cost, clean and comfortable property in a great location, the Comfort Inn will meet your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: magalia09
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, the location is fantastic, it's close to everything that the Gaslamp area has to offer. The room was clean but I truly wish I had been there when my boyfriend checked in as they put us in a room that was about 10 feet from the front door and lobby and right next to the staircase. This was very bad location. People start using the stairway at about 6am and the door causes significant noise in the room. A group of people came back at about 3am one night and stood right in front of our room for about 1/2 hour having an incredibly raucous conversation. Slept horribly both nights because of these issues. Oh, and killed a cockroach in the bathtub one night. The size of the room was fine, didn't bother me at all. But the staff was not particularly friendly or welcoming. For the price and location, I wanted to be able to recommend this place but based on all of this I just can't do it.

Reviews.Title: “Great locatoin - dumpy hotel”
Reviews.Author: OC_Adventurer
Reviews.Content: The only redeemable aspect to this hotel is it's location. If you want to be close to the Gaslamp District, it's right in the heart of it. This is why I booked it. We needed a place for Halloween festivities. Because I waited till the last minute I had to pay $200 for 1 night. Definitely a rip-off but that's the price for Halloween night. 1) The walls are very thin. We were awoken by the people above us and by the maids cleaning the rooms around us. Made for an earlier morning than normal. 2) The elevator is horribly slow. When the maids are cleaning the rooms the elevator is even slower because they are going up and down. 3) The sink was in the bedroom, not the bathroom. Very odd. This is definitely a budget hotel. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “great location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: thesnurgs
Reviews.Content: We had to stay at this hotel since it was the last one available in the gaslamp on 4th of July weekend and I can see why. This place has nothing to it and the rooms are shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Great Location”
Reviews.Author: soonerlaw
Reviews.Content: We had to go to San Diego for a wedding and were only there for two nights. We were able to garner a really good deal here through some disounts. The hotel is a small four story hotel right in the heart of Gaslamp. It does not compare to some of the larger hotels, such as the Hyatt or Marriot, but if you want a good deal and don't plan to spend all your time in your hotel, this is the way to go. It is just a block or two from 5th street, which is the happening area of town. We were able to walk to restaurants, clubs and shopping. The Seaside Harbor area is about a mile away. Overall the rooms were smaller than I had expected. Also, the sink was actually in room as opposed to the bathroom, which made it a little hard to get ready in the morning. But these are really design flaws from the original builder I would imagine, and not any fault of the Comfort. The rooms and the hotel were clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful, especially with the parking situation. The free breakfast was plentiful and filling. Overall, we didn't spend much time there except to get ready and sleep. It was comparable to other downtown big city economy class hotels but it had a little added charm due to the location. Overall, it was a good value for what we needed to utilize the hotel for. We were able to experience the culture, food and nightlife of Gaslamp within walking distance. If you are on a quick business trip or a quick leisure trip, I would recommend. If you are there vacationing, I would recommend staying at the Marriott or Hilton or Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “middle of everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: nktraveling
Reviews.Content: A friend and I of mine went there to hang out. We went to Midway, PETCO Park, Hard Rock Cafe and other fine stores. It was "home away from home" microwave, iron , hair dryer T.V. and a Refrigerator Very nice except for one or tow people asking for hangout.. Parking fee is the only negative thing I can think of right now.. Oh yes, they forgot to take out the trash but the bed was made very nicely....

Reviews.Title: “Got what I paid for!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffer66
Reviews.Content: I got the room at a fair price (under 50.00 per night). It was a clean but very small room, with a horible view. It had a fridge, safe, microwave, coffee maker and an Iron. So while it wasn't fancy, it was a good value! My one complaint, the $16.00 charge for parking was a real ripoff!!

Reviews.Title: “Hindsight 20/20”
Reviews.Author: DesertTraveler2009
Reviews.Content: the website from whom we purchased our trip had "Airport Trans, FREE " listed as an amenity. Upon arrival, I called to ask when the shuttle will arrive to take us to the hotel. The man said that they have an arrangement with another shuttle service. Well, to make a long story short, we were mislead into taking a shuttle which cost us $20.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay here”
Reviews.Author: SorchaN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn Gaslamp/Convention Center for five nights in November 2007. I was attending a conference at the convention center and wanted somewhere reasonably priced, clean, and within walking distance. I read lots of hotel reviews before booking and decided I liked the sound of the Comfort Inn. Some reviews weren't entirely positive, but I noticed that the negative comments were usually about the position of the sink or the size of the room, or other things that weren't important to me. So I went ahead and booked. I was very glad I made the decision to stay at the Comfort Inn. The staff were friendly, the room was a good size, and it was very clean. It was great to have access to the business center and the laundry facilities (clean clothes are so much easier to pack when going back home). And the breakfast that other reviewers have praised definitely lived up to expectations. Coming from the UK and therefore jet-lagged, I woke up every morning ravenously hungry, and it was really great to be able to go downstairs and wolf down bacon and sausages. The water and popcorn in the room was a nice touch. And also the fridge and microwave. As a Brit, I like to drink tea, ideally made with scalding water and a splash of milk, and that's hard to accomplish in the US where electric kettles don't seem to exist. But of course with a microwave it's possible to get the water hot enough. (I bought some really good tea leaves across the road too.) I also liked the location of the hotel. It was a quick and easy walk to the convention center; there was a small store around the corner where I could get bits and pieces; and a larger grocery store just a couple of blocks away. There were also plenty of good restaurants nearby. The area felt very safe: as a single woman I had no anxieties about walking around late at night. I had a great time and I would definitely recommend the Comfort Inn to anyone looking for a hotel in the Gaslamp area of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: omotors
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights while attending a function at the Westin. Short walk through the Gas Lamp district and an incredibly lower price. I was very impressed with the staff. Friendly and helpful. Above average, included breakfast. The hotel provided a shuttle from the airport and a taxi ride back to the airport. Free wireless Internet, fresh fruit and coffee always available. Free printing in the business center. Popcorn in the room. Friends were all complaining about the all the extra charges at the Westin for every little thing including internet access. Rooms were not large, but very clean and well appointed. All and all a very good value for the area. And I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Peace in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: PeterCallan
Reviews.Content: Very nice quaint hotel ... in keeping with the ambience of the Gaslamp District surroundings. Very comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, Great location”
Reviews.Author: lalalana
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the middle of the week for one night. I booked this hotel mainly because of the price and location. Pros - Location (within walking distance of Horton Plaza, restaurants, Seaport Village, Petco Park) - Clean rooms - Free wireless internet (other locations in this area charge by the night) - Best price for the area if you don't want a shared bathroom/ hostel-style lodging - Free breakfast (make your own waffles was nice, although we did not try it, there were some healthy options like fruit and yogurt) - Business center (we did not use the facility) - Extra amenities (included popcorn, Q-tips, cotton balls, and an emery board, free USA Today) - Staff was professional, but not necessarily friendly Cons - You have to pay for parking/ parking is very limited - Bed could use replacing (it creaked when you sat on it/turned over) - The eggs at breakfast were microwaved/fast-food quality and breakfast meats were very greasy. - Our room faced the street, so there was quite a bit of noise which did not bother us, but if you are a light sleeper consider asking for a courtyard facing room. - Bathroom sink is in the sleeping area instead of bathroom (this could be a pro if you are staying with family/friends but I didn't like it). - When I asked the lady at the front desk if she knew any way we could get discounted zoo tickets, she told us that we would have to buy them at the zoo. However, if you have a AAA card, or if you go through the tourist books you can find coupons to get discounts (which she did not mention)

Reviews.Title: “Just Like What People Are Saying”
Reviews.Author: JohnCWang1688
Reviews.Content: Partly based on the reviews I read here at Tripadvisor, we made our decision to stay at Comfort Inn Gaslamp for our July 4th getaway. Just like what people are saying, nice clean room, good breakfast, great location and friendly staff. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “plain & fairly priced”
Reviews.Author: la310la
Reviews.Content: As said in other reviews, you cannot find a better value in such a great location. Its near the Buca restaurant and is walking distance to Horton Plaza mall, the bars & restaurants and shopping in the French Quarter. I usually stay with family in San Diego, but this time we chose needed hotel and the Comfort Inn was more than ok! The rooms are small, but if you are in and out of your room, it won't be an issue. Yes, the sink is near the bed and not in the bathroom. The one thing I didn't like is all the loudness from the bars at night. You could hear music, yelling, drunken laughing. Someone was singing upstairs in a room near us?!? The hungover gals at breakfast were funny in their pjs and sunglasses. But I guess that goes with the area - as some ppl come to party in the Gaslamp bars for the weekend. There were a lot of college kids the weekend we were there prob for summer break. But they weren't rude or in your face annoying which was nice. Other than that, the place was great!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Wayfarer30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn Gaslamp from May 12-17, 2008. This is the place to be if you want a central location downtown. Fifth Avenue is literally right out the door, with all its restaurants and entertainment. The waterfront is a short 10-15 minute walk away. Petco Park, home of Padres, is also close by. You may notice that you pay a little more than you usually might for a Comfort Inn, but the location makes that extra price a good deal. As for the rooms, they are well maintained, if not exactly spacious. The sink is in the bedroom, a nod to economy of space that you get used to in about one minute. If you are part of the jet set, look elsewhere. For everyone else, it's very easy to adapt to the room layout, including the full cable TV and A/C. As noted in other reviews, the breakfast spread is a cut above the usual fare, and you can watch the latest from CNN on a flat screen. There are three computers with flat screen monitors and a printer, and also coin operated washers and dryers for that end of trip cleaning. Virtually the only drawback I could find was that elevator tends to be slow. That's easily remedied by taking the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Really not all that bad”
Reviews.Author: radioclashx
Reviews.Content: Location cannot be beat. The room was small and nothing special but did have a refrigerator. I also liked the business center where they had three computers with internet access and a printer which came in handy several times for getting directions. Has a nice little courtyard where you can sit and a full breakfast included in the price of the room. No pool obviously, but the location is great and the place is decent for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: Travelr234
Reviews.Content: Budget hotel that beats the big "plastic palaces" associated with conventions and business. Small rooms, but clean and with good amenities including free breakfast and free wireless. Pleasant 15 minute walk to Convention Center, and Gaslamp District is right out the door. Latter can be a bit noisy on party nights, but beats the sound of train whistles near waterfront. Was quite pleased with the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in So-So”
Reviews.Author: chickonamission
Reviews.Content: We knew what we were getting ourselves into, thanks to lots of reviews. Room was small, had a sink in the bedroom. But it was cheap compared to other hotels in the Gaslamp Quarter and we knew we wouldn't be spending a ton of time in it. Room was mostly fine - the bed wasn't spectacular and the elevator was slow. The location couldn't be beat. Close to everything. We parked our car for the entire time we were there because we could walk everywhere. Staff was pretty surly. Weren't very helpful with very local directions and they closed their breakfast down early. I don't know, I think that's annoying. If you say breakfast is until 9:30, don't shut it down at 9:15. And the great free breakfast they provide is basically frozen sausages, bacon etc that they stick in the microwave. Pretty inedible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Gaslamp Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: SonomaCoasters
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to restaurants and entertainment on Fourth and Fifth Avenue as well as Horton Plaza. Easy walking distance to public transportation on Broadway. Our room was compact and clean (avoid the first floor if you're a light sleeper). Breakfast was better than the usual continental. Front desk staff were very helpful with transportation arrangements to and from the airport. Try Buca di Beppo (next door) for Italian food in a kitschy atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but....”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid36
Reviews.Content: The price to be paid for the excellent location in the bustling Gaslamp area was that the facilities in this hotel are rather cramped. Parking behind the hotel is available, but at an extra $14 nightly. The bedroom was clean and tidy but the room was small and, unusually, awkwardly housed the washbasin; the bathroom being simply the shower and the loo. The single Queen bed was rather uncomfortable with a 'let's all roll towards the middle' type matress. And there were no bedside tables and reading lamps.Reception staff tried hard to be pleasant in a busy atmosphere, but were a little short on rapid and efficient response. The 'complimentary' breakfast was modest though sufficient, although the dining area is again rather cramped. The launderette facilities could be very useful to those on extended tours and overall the shortfalls described above were to some extent compensated for by the convenience of this hotel's close proximity to the vibrant Gaslamp area of San Diego with all it's bars and restaurants..

Reviews.Title: “Not Pleased”
Reviews.Author: indofranco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn July 13 - 15, 2007 and were very disappointed by the room. The location is terrific: right in the middle of the gaslamp district. The room was terrible. Extremely small room, full-size bed (not very comfortable for two people), and very warm (the AC was not working properly in our room). If you want a nice, relaxing vacation and you care at all about the room you stay in, we would not recommend staying at the Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “I must agree: Small room, but cozy and cannot beat location”
Reviews.Author: NaptownTraveler
Reviews.Content: While we kept the majority of our week and a half's worth of garments at the Clarion Hotel in Anaheim, we packed two nights worth of clothing and beauty produtcs in a duffle bag for San Diego and the famed Gaslamp District. I have been familiar with the Comfort Inn brand and the rooms can be small and just a step above motel standard setup, but the rooms here are very tiny. That being said, however, the rooms at Comfort Inn Gaslamp are very efficiently put together and just the right size for a couple who does not mind close quarters or have a lot of luggage. There is more than meets the I in these rooms. There was a mini-fridge, coffee maker, microwave, full size ironing board and steam iron (you just do not know how rare it can be to get a steam iron in a hotel sometimes), good water pressure in the shower, and plenty of drawers and lighting.
