Plus the little extras, like the cute courtyard with the mini-fountains, the beautifully decorated lounge area with the tropical fish tank, adequate business center and complimentary continental breakfast (with the famous Comfort Inn Waffles of course) make this hotel feel much more than just an older urban lodge. Not to mention the location! The Padres were playing and parking was expensive at a lot down the street ($14/night), but the desk tipped us to park early before the spaces fill up for the game that evening. We left our car there and walked around the area. There are some of the best restaurants in California just 1-2 blocks away and great shopping at several local stores and the downtown mall (fresh air mall of course in CA.) The nightlife is not to be missed if you are under 35 (in real age or in spirit.) It will take you back to those good ol college days for sure! It can get chilly in the evening, so be sure to bring a light sweater or wind-breaker type of jacket. We visited in the middle of June and it was hot during the day. If there is any cloudiness in the forecast, go to the SD Zoo, or SD Zoo's Wild Animal Park. The animals are more active when there isn't direct sun. All in all, we will probably visit this Comfort Inn again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Friendly Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rachel805
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute at hotels.com for about $135/night in late May. Parking was another $14. The room was tiny on a ground floor with a window that looked across at the housekeeping room. But the staff was extremely friendly, the continental breakfast just fine, and the location was in superb walking distance to so many great restaurants. Recommend Ramas - fantastic. For a good price and great location would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly but great location”
Reviews.Author: Quiquine
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, a few blocks from trolley and great restaurants and bars. Room looked like a dental office with neon light and no decoration, but at least it was very clean. It had no view at all. Fridge and microwave in room (just close to the sink, I did not like having toiletries just next to the cofee machine and microwave, but anyway...), safe. 3 PC with free internet in "Business center" with free coffee. Would go back just for the location.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: prescottdoug
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice. It has a better location. Downtown has alot of homeless but it still feels safe.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in room #116!!!”
Reviews.Author: rab123
Reviews.Content: The original assigned room was the worst room I have experience in nearly 35 years of travel. AC was terrible, window unit that didn't work well. About 150 square feet of space. Sink outside of bathroom, 2 feet from the bed! Just terrible!! I was moved the second night, after much pleading, to an acceptable room. Price no bargain for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible...”
Reviews.Author: BobC357
Reviews.Content: In town for a convention, big hotels are booked or overpriced. Comfort Inn is really not too bad. Within easy walking distance to the convention center. Yes, the rooms are small and there's noise from the street, but this is Gaslamp and there's lots of activity outside. The room is clean and the staff is friendly. Microwave, refrigerator & coffee maker in the room. Free wireless Internet. Free shuttle from the airport, free 'breakfast'; I really can't complain. Are they really going to charge me 50 cents per day for the room safe? Expect to pay about half of what the Marriott, Hilton or Hyatt is charging. For that kind of money, Comfort Inn is worth it; otherwise, you might find something better.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn was a very convenient location for our San Diego trip. The room was a bit small and there was a significant amount of street noise, but the bed was comfortable and room was clean. The staff at the hotel were among the friendliest I have encountered. There is an continental breakfast, and FREE wireless internet. I would recommend requesting a room that does not face the street, which should make for a much quieter night's sleep.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn Gaslamp / Convention Center
HotelInfo.Address: 660 G St, San Diego, CA 92101
